meanings.definition: A person who screws or fastens objects together.
meanings.sent1: The screwers worked together to build the new bookshelf.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew consisted of skilled screwers.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the fastest screwer was intense at the assembly line.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed made him the fastest screwer in the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The young apprentice learned from the experienced screwers in the factory.

meanings.definition: Plural form of the word 'screwer', referring to multiple individuals who screw or fasten objects together.
meanings.sent1: The team of screwers completed the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: The group of screwers shared tips and tricks with each other.
meanings.sent3: The community celebrated the hard work of the dedicated screwers.
meanings.sent4: Their unity as screwers made them a formidable force in construction.
meanings.sent5: The band of screwers was known for their efficiency and precision.

meanings.definition: A tool used for turning screws or bolts.
meanings.sent1: He reached for the screwers to tighten the loose screw.
meanings.sent2: The toolbox contained various sizes of screwers for different tasks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the box of screwers, causing a clatter.
meanings.sent4: The old screwers had served him well over the years.
meanings.sent5: She carefully selected the right screwer for the job to avoid any mishaps.
